protocol_name: Single-cell mapping of lineage and identity via CellTagging
protocol_name_html: Single-cell mapping of lineage and identity via CellTagging
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7vmf1","text":"Single-cell technologies are offering unprecedented insight into complex biology, revealing the behavior of rare cell populations that are typically masked in bulk population analyses. One current limitation of single-cell approaches is that lineage relationships are lost as a result of cell processing, restricting interpretations of the data collected. Elegant computational approaches have been developed in an effort to infer these missing observations, but it remains a challenge to reconstruct true reprogramming trajectories using these tools. Although sophisticated lineage tracing solutions to connect cell history with fate are emerging, these protocols are either not compatible with high-throughput scRNA-seq, or require genome editing strategies that are not readily deployed in some systems. Here, our protocol describes a single-cell resolution clonal tracking approach, ‘CellTagging’, based on combinatorial cell indexing, permitting the parallel capture of lineage information and cell identity. CellTagging integrates with high-throughput single-cell RNA-sequencing, where iterative rounds of cell labeling enable the construction of multi-level lineage trees. This straightforward lentiviral-labeling approach can be applied to an array of cell biological applications to simultaneously profile lineage and identity, at single-cell resolution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"9iquf","text":"Day 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"24ij0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ocb5","text":"Plate MEFs at a density of 50,000 cells in a well of a 6-well plate, on 1% gelatin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dmisn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bnra5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"3adqd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"23h9r","text":"The starting number of cells is an extremely important consideration: to maximize the number and size of clones that can be detected and traced, we recommend keeping the starting cell population to be CellTagged relatively small. The downstream choice of single-cell capture platform is also important to consider here. For example, platforms with a higher cell capture efficiency require fewer cells to be loaded, therefore supporting the plating and culture of smaller numbers of cells in these early stages. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"D8399DE0E04511E890708FA6729098B7","id":679326,"previous_id":679310,"previous_guid":"2F796280DFE111E88D543949083CEE53","section":"Transduction of cells with CellTag lentivirus"}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"4kalt","text":"Day 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5q3m9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dhuft","text":"Transduce cells with the CellTag viral library overnight. We transduce cells with fresh viral supernatant, with the addition of protamine sulfate. Polybrene can also be used to enhance transduction efficiency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4vi2m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"ehk3j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5kctq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3mmn0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"reagents","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":139733,"guid":"85A764C0E04711E890708FA6729098B7","align":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Protamine Sulfate","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"","sku":"P3369-10G","url":"https:\/\/www.sigmaaldrich.com\/catalog\/product\/sigma\/p3369?lang=en&region=US&gclid=CjwKCAjwsfreBRB9EiwAikSUHUQ9Be_qojSA8pJIN_8XO4irYmMAuyIW3VdLkitGYpfRfM2qEwSvOxoCDSkQAvD_BwE","vendor":{"name":"Sigma Aldrich","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"http:\/\/sigmaaldrich.com","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":17},"can_edit":0,"step_guid":"9C6C35B0E04611E890708FA6729098B7","public":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"85e8u","text":"We transduce MEFs at a multiplicity of infection (MOI) of around 3-4. This results in each cell expressing a unique combination of CellTags, increasing the confidence of downstream clone calling. We do not track cells expressing fewer than 2 CellTags. With an MOI of ~3, we find that around 70% of MEFs express 2 or more CellTags.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72s10","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7aer4","text":"We use fresh viral supernatant for this step. For some cell types, the media is not compatible, or the cells are sensitive to supernatant. In these cases, we recommend concentration of CellTag viral particles via ultracentrifugation, followed by resuspension in fresh media. In our experience, MEFs, 293Ts, and B-cells respond well to viral transduction with supernatant. Difficult to transduce cells may also benefit from viral concentration and spinfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"9C6C35B0E04611E890708FA6729098B7","id":679327,"previous_id":679326,"previous_guid":"D8399DE0E04511E890708FA6729098B7","section":"Transduction of cells with CellTag lentivirus"}

For example, many clones will be detected from early stages in fast-growing cells. steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"acbsa","text":"Harvest cells for single-cell RNA-sequencing. BMC Biol. 15, 44 (2017) (https:\/\/bmcbiol.biomedcentral.com\/articles\/10.1186\/s12915-017-0383-5)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":120,"length":68,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"5ivoa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"arppf","text":"See also: https:\/\/support.10xgenomics.com\/single-cell-gene-expression\/sample-prep\/doc\/demonstrated-protocol-methanol-fixation-of-cells-for-single-cell-rna-sequencing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":10,"length":155,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"19b08","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"27cdk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"18h3g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/bmcbiol.biomedcentral.com\/articles\/10.1186\/s12915-017-0383-5"}},{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/support.10xgenomics.com\/single-cell-gene-expression\/sample-prep\/doc\/demonstrated-protocol-methanol-fixation-of-cells-for-single-cell-rna-sequencing"}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"bv4he","text":"For timecourse analyses, we recommend fixation of cells followed by single-cell processing and library preparation within the same batch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fu6au","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ad0qu","text":"For single-cell processing via 10x Genomics, we methanol fix a minimum of 10,000 cells per sample. Ideally, 25,000 cells are fixed to yield ~10,000 single-cell transcriptomes per sample. For Drop-seq, we fix a minimum of 100,000 per sample. We have found that methanol fixation works well for MEFs, B-cells, and 293Ts but performance can vary depending on cell type. We recommend that this is assessed for each cell type.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"85973B50E04B11E890708FA6729098B7","id":679331,"previous_id":679330,"previous_guid":"FFD8F350E04A11E890708FA6729098B7","section":"Cell harvest and replating for clonal tracking"}
steps.section: Cell harvest and replating for clonal tracking

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"2hqo4","text":"To support lineage reconstruction, replated cells can be further CellTagged with V2 and V3 libraries. For MEFs, we CellTagged cells with the V2 library 5 days following V1 CellTagging. We followed this with the V3 library 15 days after V1 CellTagging. Again, this is highly cell-type and protocol dependent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2iohv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"86ts7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"i62s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"8prpd","text":"Analysis of clonal expansion can be achieved with one round of tagging with the CellTag V1 pooled library. For more complex lineage reconstruction to support the detection of lineage bifurcations, we recommend subsequent CellTagging with V2 and V3 pooled libraries. For lineage reconstruction, it is critical to use these different libraries which contain unique motifs to support CellTag demultiplexing and reconstruction in downstream analyses.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"9C46C4A0E04C11E890708FA6729098B7","id":679332,"previous_id":679331,"previous_guid":"85973B50E04B11E890708FA6729098B7","section":"Cell harvest and replating for clonal tracking"}
steps.section: Cell harvest and replating for clonal tracking

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"9fhu7","text":"Following harvest of all samples, cells should be processed for single-cell capture, library preparation, and sequencing using 10x Genomics or Drop-seq platforms, according to the standard protocols. CellTag transcripts are effectively captured via these standard workflows and no additional steps are required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cfj73","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bgemk","text":"For fixed cell rehydration, please refer to: https:\/\/support.10xgenomics.com\/single-cell-gene-expression\/sample-prep\/doc\/demonstrated-protocol-methanol-fixation-of-cells-for-single-cell-rna-sequencing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":45,"length":155,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"efp53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ga72","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"14qr0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/support.10xgenomics.com\/single-cell-gene-expression\/sample-prep\/doc\/demonstrated-protocol-methanol-fixation-of-cells-for-single-cell-rna-sequencing"}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"e1jkl","text":"On both the 10x Genomics and Drop-seq platforms, we aim to sequence cells to a depth of at least 30,000 reads per cell. Overall, keeping the cell population size relatively small and the proportion of these cells sequenced high, this will increase the number and size of clones detected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"78E1D5D0E04D11E890708FA6729098B7","id":679333,"previous_id":679332,"previous_guid":"9C46C4A0E04C11E890708FA6729098B7","section":"Cell harvest and replating for clonal tracking"}
